      • generatePartition

        public static int[][] generatePartition​(int[] indices,
                                        int num,
                                        Random r)
        Generate a random Partition.
        TODO can generate 'indices' inside, given L
        Get a random layout of 'num' sets of 'indices'.
        Parameters:
        indices - [0,1,2,...,L-1]
        num - number of super-nodes to generate (between 1 and L)
        r - Random, if == null, then don't randomize
        Returns:
        partition

      • generatePartition

        public static int[][] generatePartition​(int[] indices,
                                        int num,
                                        Random r,
                                        boolean balanced)
        Generate Random Partition
        Parameters:
        indices - label indices
        num - the number of partitions
        r - Random, if == null, then don't randomize
        balanced - indicate if balanced (same number of labels in each set) or not
        Returns:
        SORTED partition

      • getPartitionFromDatasetHierarchy

        public static final int[][] getPartitionFromDatasetHierarchy​(weka.core.Instances D)
        Get Partition From Dataset Hierarchy - assumes attributes are hierarchically arranged with '.'. For example europe.spain indicates leafnode spain of branch europe.
        Parameters:
        D - Dataset
        Returns:
        partition

      • makePartitionDataset

        public static weka.core.Instances makePartitionDataset​(weka.core.Instances D,
                                                       int[] part)
                                                throws Exception
        Make Partition Dataset - out of dataset D, on indices part[].
        Parameters:
        D - regular multi-label dataset (of L = classIndex() labels)
        part - list of indices we want to make into an LP dataset.
        Returns:
        Dataset with 1 multi-valued class label, representing the combinations of part[].
        Throws:
        Exception

      • makePartitionDataset

        public static weka.core.Instances makePartitionDataset​(weka.core.Instances D,
                                                       int[] part,
                                                       int P,
                                                       int N)
                                                throws Exception
        Make Partition Dataset - out of dataset D, on indices part[].
        Parameters:
        D - regular multi-label dataset (of L = classIndex() labels)
        part - list of indices we want to make into a PS dataset.
        P - see PSUtils
        N - see PSUtils
        Returns:
        Dataset with 1 multi-valued class label, representing the combinations of part[].
        Throws:
        Exception

      • extractValues

        public static int[][] extractValues​(weka.core.Instances D_)
        Returns a map of values for this multi-class Instances. For example, values {[2,3,1], [1,0,1, [2,0,1]}.
        Parameters:
        D_ - multi-class Instances
        Returns:
        a map where map[d] returns an int[] array of all values referred to by the d-th classification.

      • getCounts

        public static HashMap<String,Integer> getCounts​(weka.core.Instances D,
                                                int[] indices,
                                                int p)
        Return a set of all the combinations of attributes at 'indices' in 'D', pruned by 'p'; AND THEIR COUNTS, e.g., {(00:3),(01:8),(11:3))}.

      • SLTransformation

        public static weka.core.Instances SLTransformation​(weka.core.Instances D,
                                                   int[][] indices,
                                                   int p,
                                                   int n)
        Super Label Transformation - transform dataset D into a dataset with k multi-class target attributes. Use the NSR/PS-style pruning and recomposition, according to partition 'indices', and pruning values 'p' and 'n'.
        Parameters:
        indices - m by k: m super variables, each relating to k original variables
        D - either multi-label or multi-target dataset
        p - pruning value
        n - subset relpacement value
        Returns:
        a multi-target dataset
        See Also:
        PSUtils.PSTransformation
